result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xavier M King

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Xavier M King appeared by video.  Attorney Annette E Rauch appeared by video for Xavier M King.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defendant has a TAD evaluation scheduled. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 103375,
Payable Number: 1042049,
Receipt Number: 22RP043537,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Xavier M King appeared, pro se, by video.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Court allows the defendant time to consult with or retain an attorney due to a potential deferred prosecution agreement resolution in this matter.  Case adjourned for status in Branch 30.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1
Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Xavier M King appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Defendant does not want an attorney and requests to represent himself. 
Upon questioning, the Court finds the defendant competent to proceed and knowingly and voluntarily waives right to counsel. 
State to provide discovery to defendant via email. Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Xavier M King in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/16/2022@2pm
